business.headline: Gold jumps Rs 6,000, silver soars Rs 10,000: How Iran–US tensions affect your moneyGold and silver surged as Iran–US tensions drove investors towards safer assets. The big question is, what does this mean for your money?

RVNL, IRFC down up to 5%: Why are these railway stocks falling today?RVNL was down 5.74% to Rs 298.20 at around 12:03 pm, while IRFC shares were down 4.65% to Rs 98.74. The weakness in these names comes at a time when sentiment across domestic equities has turned cautious as global risk appetite faded and benchmark indices weakened.

L&T share price tumbles over 5%. Why is the stock falling today?L&T's slide highlights how surging crude and geopolitical uncertainty are unsettling infrastructure stocks, prompting investors to reassess cost risks and project visibility until conditions stabilise in conflict-hit regions.

Paras Defence shares jump 12%: Why are defence stocks rising today?Defence stocks across the board were firm even as the rest of the market struggled with weak sentiment linked to rising crude prices and the worsening conflict involving Iran and the United States.

Sensex crashes 1,500 points amid Iran-US conflict: 6 things you need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex fell sharply in early trade, and the NSE Nifty50 also slipped more than 1%, as investors reacted to the fast-changing situation between the US, Israel and Iran.

Sensex tanks 1,000 points as oil surges amid ongoing Iran-US conflictThe S&P BSE Sensex fell over 1,000 points in early trade, slipping below 81,000. The NSE Nifty50 dropped under 24,900. This was one of the steepest opening declines in recent weeks.

Will stock market fall today amid Iran's war with the US, Israel?Early signals from Gift Nifty suggest a weak start. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,60 points at 8:30 am. This indicates that the benchmark Nifty 50 may open below Friday's close of 25,178.65.

Sufficient stock, India won't face immediate oil disruption amid Iran crisisIndia imports 88 per cent of its crude oil – the raw material for making fuels like petrol and diesel – and about half of its requirement for natural gas - the feedstock for generating electricity, producing fertiliser, fuel for household kitchens and CNG for automobiles – and cooking gas LPG.

India built UPI and Aadhaar, is it time for an Aatmanirbhar credit score too?A three-digit number may look small on paper. But for millions of Indians, it quietly decides how far they can go. India built digital infrastructure for identity (AADHAAR) and payment (UPI). The next question is whether credit deserves the same clarity and control.

Warner Bros Discovery signs $110 billion deal with Paramount SkydanceWarner Bros Discovery agreed to a $110 billion acquisition by Paramount Skydance after Netflix declined to match the offer, creating a media powerhouse set to reshape Hollywood and streaming competition.

From FDs to mutual funds: How Indians are changing their investment behaviourFor years, FDs and real estate were the first choice for Indian savers seeking safety and certainty. Now, mutual funds are steadily gaining popularity, especially among first-time investors looking for higher returns. Is this the beginning of a long-term shift in how Indians invest?

India's Q3 GDP grows 7.8% as government rolls out new base year seriesThe Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation introduced a new series of GDP estimates with 2022-23 as the base year, replacing the earlier 2011-12 base.

Sensex, Nifty fall over 1% as global worries mount; auto, financial shares tankThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.

Pakistan to run short of flour? Wheat output likely to fall amid Afghanistan warAccording to a report by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), Pakistan's wheat production is expected to decline by 2 to 2.2 million tonnes compared to last year.

Including property in your will? Here's how to avoid family and legal conflictsA house is often the most valuable thing people leave behind. Yet, without proper details in a Will, like ownership clarity, liabilities, and documentation, it can become the very reason families face delays and disagreements instead of closure. Is your Will detailed enough to prevent that?

Why India's growing wealth is driving investment into luxury real estateAs capital increases, investors become more careful. The focus shifts from chasing returns to protecting value. This is why luxury real estate is gaining importance in serious portfolios.

Silver jumps over Rs 8,000: Time to invest, hold or sell?Silver shot up by over Rs 8,000, marking a fresh high in recent trading. With momentum high but volatility looming, the big question is: is it time to invest or sell?

What are Life Cycle Funds and how can they make your retirement planning easier?Life cycle funds are designed to adjust their asset allocation automatically as an investor moves closer to a specific goal, usually retirement.

Sensex closes 961 points lower: Why stock market fell todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.  Both indices lost over 1%.

entertainment.headline: Actor Esha Gupta shares how UAE is helping stranded people amid Middle East conflict Actor Esha Gupta shared her experience of being unable to leave Abu Dhabi due to travel delays caused by the escalation of the Israel-US-Iran conflict. In a post on social media, she expressed her appreciation for local authorities and her wish to return to India.

Rashmika-Vijay Deverakonda attend Sathyanarayana Puja at his hometown. Watch Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda attended a grand Sathyanarayana puja at their new home in Thummanpet, Telangana. Villagers welcomed the newlyweds with music and dance.

Actor Renu Desai warns trolls over abusive comments about past with Pawan Kalyan Actor Renu Desai has issued a legal warning to trolls targeting her personal life and using abusive language. She said that the online abuse has increased harassment since her divorce from Pawan Kalyan.

Did Vijay's son Jason Sanjay unfollow him on Instagram amid divorce case? It was rumoured that Jason Sanjay had unfollowed his father, Vijay, on Instagram. Last week, Sangeetha filed for divorce from Vijay, seeking the court's intervention to end 27 years of marriage.

Zendaya-Tom Holland secretly married? Stylist hints fans are late to wedding news Buzz around Zendaya and Tom Holland's wedding plans has picked up pace after celebrity stylist Law Roach dropped a tantalising hint during a recent red carpet interview.
The Kerala Story 2 box office Day 3: Film crosses Rs 10 crore in opening weekend The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond crossed Rs 10.40 crore at the domestic box office in its opening weekend.

Karan Aujla's Delhi concert turns chaotic after violent crowd clash. Watch A massive crowd gathered at Karan Aujla's Delhi concert on February 28, where an altercation broke out inside the venue. Video of the fight has emerged online, with many raising concerns about security and event management.

Mahesh Babu says Priyanka was swashbuckling in The Bluff, she teases Antartica meet Mahesh Babu praised Priyanka Chopra's "swashbuckling" and power-packed performance in The Bluff. Chopra thanked him warmly as the two gear up to share screen space in SS Rajamouli's upcoming film Varanasi.

Sanju Samson's knock is 'The Kerala Story': Malayalam celebs praise cricketer Sanju Samson played a masterful unbeaten 97 to guide India in a crucial T20 World Cup match. Tamil director CS Amudhan called his knock the 'kerala story'. Malayalam film stars including, Mammootty, Mohanlal, Prithviraj, Dulquer and many others, praised his fearless innings.

Actor Awards 2026 winner list: Owen Cooper and Noah Wyle win big The 32nd annual Actor Awards, formerly the SAG Awards, took place in Los Angeles with Kristen Bell as host. The ceremony, featuring six movie and nine television categories, is livestreamed on Netflix.

Front row at Shakira's concert? Singer's Mumbai show ticket hits Rs 32,000 After nearly 19 long years, Shakira is finally returning to India this April with electrifying shows lined up in Mumbai and Delhi. The buzz is sky-high, and so are the ticket prices, soaring up to Rs 32,000.

Is it really him? Jim Carrey's rare Paris appearance sparks buzz over new look Actor Jim Carrey made a rare public appearance at the Cesar Awards in Paris, instantly grabbing attention online.  Fans expressed their disbelief over his dramatically changed look.

Rajpal Yadav hits back at director Priyadarshan for saying he is poorly educated Rajpal Yadav addressed filmmaker Priyadarshan's remarks about his education and professionalism. He said he considers the director his father figure.

Last flight out: Composer Santhosh Narayanan's lucky escape amid Middle East chaos Music composer Santhosh Narayanan shared his experience of leaving Qatar just ahead of airport shutdowns amid rising tensions between the US, Israel and Iran. Hours later, he confirmed that he had landed safely in the United States.

Rashmika-Vijay's Hyderabad wedding reception to be invite-only Rashmika and Vijay's wedding reception on March 4 will be a strictly invitation-only event. The reception will follow police recommendations to manage public excitement and ensure safety.

Rashmika-Vijay join Allu family for Sirish's Pelli Koduku ceremony. See pics Allu Sirish's pre-wedding celebrations drew major film industry personalities, with special attention on the presence of Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna. Sirish is set to marry fiancee Nayanika Reddy on March 6.

Bengali actor Subhashree Ganguly, son stranded in Dubai amid Middle East conflict Bengali actor Subhashree Ganguly and her young son Yuvaan are stuck in Dubai amid rising tension following Iranian attacks in the region. Her family hopes for their safe return.

Rashmika Mandanna invites Telangana CM Revanth Reddy to wedding reception Rashmika Mandanna met Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy to invite him to the reception of her wedding with Vijay Deverakonda, and shared pictures of the meeting.

Ram Charan begins dubbing for Peddi, shares fun studio video Ram Charan has started dubbing for the sports drama, Peddi, with the production team assuring audiences that the film will release worldwide on April 30, 2026 in multiple languages.

general news.headline: Video: US F-15 crashes in Kuwait in likely friendly fire hit by Patriot SAM systemA US F-15 fighter jet crashed in Kuwait on Monday after reportedly being engaged by a Patriot air defence system, with debris falling inside the Mina Al Ahmadi refinery and injuring two workers.

Live: Smoke rises over US embassy in Kuwait, Bahrain base reportedly hit againUS-Israel's Iran Strikes Live Updates: The Middle East remained on the boil for a third day on Monday as Iran expanded its retaliation against the joint US-Israeli strikes that eliminated its Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and wiped out several senior figures of the Iranian military and political circles.

US President Donald Trump has countered Tehran's warning of attacks on American and Israeli interests by saying that such a move would invite consequences of "unprecedented" levels. Meanwhile, Iran's military retaliated across the Middle East with hundreds of missile and drone attacks, with the US confirming the first three deaths of American service members killed in the wider campaign.

During the day, Israel said it had launched another wave of strikes on Iran, while loud blasts were heard for a second day near Dubai and over Doha, after Iran launched retaliatory air attacks on the neighbouring Gulf states. Follow IndiaToday.in for live updates:

Pak's Nur Khan base, under repair after Op Sindoor, struck by TalibanTaliban forces reportedly launched armed drone strikes targeting Pakistan's Command and Control Centre at Nur Khan Air Base in Rawalpindi. Taliban forces carried out drone strikes on 12th division headquarters in Quetta, and other Pakistani military locations in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

Head of snake cut off: US says Iran Revolutionary Guard's headquarters decimatedThe United States military on Monday claimed it had completely destroyed the Tehran headquarters of Iran's elite Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC).

Not built in a day: The making of Jammu & Kashmir's Ranji Trophy triumphFor decades, Jammu & Kashmir flirted with promise without sustaining it. Their maiden Ranji Trophy title was no miracle, but the product of structural reform, cultural reset, and relentless discipline. It is proof that ambition, when engineered properly, can finally endure.

Live: Mark Carney meets PM Modi in Delhi as leaders seek to reset tiesMark Carney in India Live Updates: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and Prime Minister Narendra Modi are set to hold bilateral talks today, during which the two leaders are expected to unveil a broad framework to strengthen India-Canada cooperation in trade, energy and critical technologies, as both sides seek to reset ties strained since the 2023 diplomatic row over Khalistani separatist activities. Carney met External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and will participate in the India-Canada CEOs' Forum later. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

Khamenei's death: Have US, Israel achieved their goals, or is Iran unbreakable?Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's killing by the US and Israel was meant to break the system in Iran. Instead, it has tested it, and, for now, it has seemingly strengthened it. The conflict is widening across the Middle East, and it appears that Iran is not going to step back.

The batter who came in from the cold: Sanju Samson's night, Eden Gardens' legendT20 World Cup, India vs West Indies: Sanju Samson had long been the backup, the nearly man—the gifted cricketer forever waiting for his turn. On Sunday night at Eden Gardens, Samson made sure no one would ever doubt him again.
Pakistan's polycrisis and its 1979 rootsThree tectonic events in Saudi Arabia, Iran, and Afghanistan reshaped the Pakistan of today.

Sensex crashes 1,500 points amid Iran-US conflict: 6 things you need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex fell sharply in early trade, and the NSE Nifty50 also slipped more than 1%, as investors reacted to the fast-changing situation between the US, Israel and Iran.

Iran won't negotiate with US: Security chief blasts Trump amid raging conflictAli Larijani, a long-time advisor of Iran's slain Supreme Leader, accused US President Donald Trump of "plunging the region chaos with his 'false hopes'," as the conflict between the two nations continued for a third day on Monday.

Man who stabbed ex-Muslim YouTuber Saleem Wastik killed in UP police encounterZeeshan, one of the men who stabbed ex-Muslim YouTuber Saleem Wastik in Loni, Ghaziabad, was killed in a police encounter on Sunday. Wastik is in hospital and his condition is critical.

How the richest pay Rs 15,000 for gareebi darshan in DharaviIn Mumbai's Dharavi, poverty is being curated, priced and sold to dollar-rich visitors. Slum tourism has been around in India for decades, but there is a thin line between giving context, and commodification. Both rich Mumbaikars and poor Dharavi residents are making money, charging Rs 15,000 per foreign tourist for gareebi darshan.

Satellite images show damage across Iranian military sites after US-Israel strikesFresh satellite imagery shows visible damage to air, drone and naval facilities near Iran's Konarak region amid escalating regional tensions. The visuals offer independently verifiable evidence of infrastructure impact as regional hostilities continue to widen.

Rashmika-Vijay join Allu family for Sirish's Pelli Koduku ceremony. See picsAllu Sirish's pre-wedding celebrations drew major film industry personalities, with special attention on the presence of Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna. Sirish is set to marry fiancee Nayanika Reddy on March 6.

31 killed in Lebanon in retaliatory Israeli strikes in respone to Hezbollah's rocket attackThe Israel Defense Forces confirmed it carried out strikes on "senior Hezbollah terrorists in the Beirut area" and a "central Hezbollah commander in southern Lebanon." The strikes reportedly hit areas including Dahiyeh, a Hezbollah stronghold in the capital's southern suburbs.

Bright Sun lights up Earth every day, then why is space so dark?This new series from India Today Science explores the why and how behind everyday phenomena we notice, wonder, but often overlook. Today, we look at the cosmic mystery of the dark night sky.

Sanju Samson's knock is 'The Kerala Story': Malayalam celebs praise cricketerSanju Samson played a masterful unbeaten 97 to guide India in a crucial T20 World Cup match. Tamil director CS Amudhan called his knock the 'kerala story'. Malayalam film stars including, Mammootty, Mohanlal, Prithviraj, Dulquer and many others, praised his fearless innings.

Ordered to pay Rs 12,000 alimony, man claims Rs 9,000 salary. Court's responseThe Supreme Court questioned a man's claim that he earns only Rs 325 per day and cannot pay Rs 12,000 monthly alimony, calling it "impossible" in present times.

Why OpenAI rushed to partner with US Military after Trump banned AnthropicOpenAI executives have given more information regarding the AI startup's contract with the US Department of Defense after facing backlash online. The Sam Altman-led startup has clarified that it will not allow for any unconstitutional acts to be done with its AI models. Here are the details.

Drunk driver hits traffic constable, drags him on Mercedes bonnet for 1 kmThe constable was dragged for nearly a kilometer before other motorists and police personnel intercepted the car. A breath analyser test showed alcohol levels far exceeding the permissible limit. Based on the complaint and CCTV footage, two separate cases have been registered against the 24-year-old accused.

Is UAE a country? Who are the Gulf nations? Middle East geography explainedAmid rising tensions involving Iran, Israel and the United States, many readers are confused about basic Middle East geography. Is the UAE a single country or a collection of states? Which nations are referred to as "Gulf states"? This explainer clearly breaks down the UAE's structure, the GCC members, and where Iran and Israel fit geographically.

Rajpal Yadav hits back at director Priyadarshan for saying he is poorly educatedRajpal Yadav addressed filmmaker Priyadarshan's remarks about his education and professionalism. He said he considers the director his father figure.

Satellite images show smoke rising over Dubai after Iranian drone, missile strikesFresh satellite imagery captured on March 1 shows smoke plumes and burn marks across parts of Dubai following Iranian retaliatory drone and missile attacks across Gulf states, signalling the widening geographic impact of the escalating regional conflict.

sports.headline: Spain vs Argentina Finalissima in Qatar at risk after US, Israel attacks on Iran Escalating tensions in the Middle East have cast uncertainty over the highly anticipated Finalissima between Spain and Argentina, originally set for March 27 in Doha. The Qatar Football Association's suspension of all tournaments, along with delays to other regional matches, has led organisers to reconsider the feasibility of hosting the event amid recent air strikes from US and Israel on Iran.

India to host Afghanistan for one Test and a three-match ODI series in June 2026 The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) on Monday confirmed that Afghanistan are set to visit India in June 2026 to play a standalone Test and a three-match One-Day International (ODI) series.

Sanju Samson's Kolkata blitz on par with Kohli's MCG knock vs PAK: Srikkanth T20 World Cup: Kris Srikkanth has claimed that Sanju Samson's innings in Kolkata is on par with the knock played by Virat Kohli at the MCG in the T20 World Cup 2022 against Pakistan. Samson's 97 helped India reach the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Switched off phone, stayed away from social media: Sanju on handling tough phases India opener Sanju Samson switched off his phone and stayed away from social media to safeguard his self-belief during a lean patch, a phase that ended with a match-winning knock in the do-or-die T20 World Cup clash against the West Indies.

The batter who came in from the cold: Sanju Samson's night, Eden Gardens' legend T20 World Cup, India vs West Indies: Sanju Samson had long been the backup, the nearly man—the gifted cricketer forever waiting for his turn. On Sunday night at Eden Gardens, Samson made sure no one would ever doubt him again.

Rulayega kya pagle? Sanju Samson's hilarious reaction to Surya's praises: Video T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav's praises were so high for Sanju Samson that the Indian wicketkeeper had to step in and ask the Indian captain not to make him cry in hilarious fashion. Samson's sensational knock helped India make it to the semi-final of the T20 World Cup.

Not built in a day: The making of Jammu & Kashmir's Ranji Trophy triumph For decades, Jammu & Kashmir flirted with promise without sustaining it. Their maiden Ranji Trophy title was no miracle, but the product of structural reform, cultural reset, and relentless discipline. It is proof that ambition, when engineered properly, can finally endure.

Daniil Medvedev stranded in Dubai with his family due to Middle East conflict Former world No. 1 Daniil Medvedev, along with his family and team, was stranded in Dubai on Sunday, a day after winning the Dubai Duty Free Tennis Championships for his 23rd career ATP title.

Abhishek Sharma's lack of form: His head is muddled, says Anil Kumble T20 World Cup: Anil Kumble feels that Abhishek Sharma's lack of form in the T20 World Cup 2026 is down to a mental issue after the Indian opener failed in the must-win clash against the West Indies. Abhishek was dismissed for 10 off 11 balls in Kolkata.

T20 World Cup: Sunil Gavaskar, Ravi Shastri slam mid-match laser show in Kolkata T20 World Cup, IND vs WI: Former India cricketers Sunil Gavaskar and Ravi Shastri condemned the laser show held during India's innings at Eden Gardens in Kolkata on Sunday night.

Samson played best knock of his life but India not playing good cricket: Amir ICC T20 World Cup: After India proved Mohammad Amir wrong by storming into the semi-finals, the former Pakistan pacer has reignited debate, conceding that Sanju Samson produced the knock of his life, while insisting that India, as a unit, are still not playing good cricket.

At Eden Gardens, Sanju Samson showed the only race worth running is your ownT20 World Cup: He was overlooked, benched, and made to wait. But Sanju Samson never stopped believing. At Eden Gardens, he finally got to show the world exactly what that belief was worth.

Surya bows down to Samson after Kolkata blitz: Good things happen to good peopleT20 World Cup: India captain Suryakumar Yadav took off his cap and bowed down for his match-winner, Sanju Samson, after the wicketkeeper guided the hosts home in their must-win clash against West Indies in Kolkata.

Shai Hope snaps back at reporter, takes blame for West Indies' loss against IndiaWest Indies captain Shai Hope snapped back at a reporter and accepted blame for his team's loss against India in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8 fixture in Kolkata. India's five-wicket win helped them secure a semi-final berth.

Worth the wait: Gambhir's mic and Samson's bat do the talking in KolkataIND vs WI, T20 World Cup: At Eden Gardens, Sanju Samson finally silenced the what ifs with a 97-run masterpiece. But in the press box, Gautam Gambhir was just getting started, dismantling data, defying tropes, and settling a few 2011-sized scores.

Manchester United in top three after come-from-behind win over Crystal PalacePremier League: Manchester United came back from behind to beat Crystal Palace 2-1 at home on Sunday. Under their interim boss Michael Carrick, United are unbeaten in seven and back in the top three for the first time since May 2023.

We all can go home with our heads held high: Shai HopeT20 World Cup, IND vs WI: West Indies captain Shai Hope reflected on his team's campaign after their exit in the Super 8 stages following a five-wicket defeat to India at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

Sanju Samson is world-class, always knew he would deliver: Gautam GambhirT20 World Cup 2026: Speaking to the press after India's Super 8 win over West Indies in Kolkata, head coach Gautam Gambhir heaped praise on Sanju Samson's unbeaten 97. He also outlined India's plans for Jasprit Bumrah and reiterated his belief in instinct over data and numbers.

With lessons from Rohit and Virat, Sanju Samson emerges India's hero in KolkataSanju Samson led India to a record-breaking T20 World Cup chase against the West Indies. He scored an unbeaten 97* (50) with the help of 12 fours and four sixes.

Shashi Tharoor thrilled for Sanju Samson: Thiruvananthapuram's son, pride of IndiaT20 World Cup, IND vs WI: Shashi Tharoor heaped praise on Sanju Samson after the Indian batter scored an unbeaten 97 and powered India into the semis with a five-wicket win over the West Indies on Sunday.

Take that: Mohammad Amir severely trolled after India storm into T20 World Cup semisT20 World Cup, IND vs WI: Ex-Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir was trolled after India secured their berth in the semifinals with a five-wicket win over the West Indies on Sunday, March 1 at the iconic Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

IND vs WI: Sanju Samson's Virat Kohli-esque special powers India into semifinalIND vs WI, T20 World Cup Super 8: Sanju Samson produced a masterclass in chasing under pressure on Sunday, crafting an unbeaten 97 to lead India past West Indies' daunting 195 at Eden Gardens. India will take on England in the semifinals on Thursday in Mumbai.

Drop catches, out cheaply: Abhishek Sharma endures horror night at Eden GardensT20 World Cup, IND vs WI: Abhishek Sharma had a night to forget at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata after he dropped two catches and scored only 10 runs off 12 balls against West Indies.

Suryakumar Yadav turns Superman, takes flying catch to dismiss Roston ChaseIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav took a spectacular diving catch to dismiss Roston Chase during the Super 8 fixture of T20 World Cup 2026 against West Indies at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. Jasprit Bumrah claimed two key wickets in the 12th over to bring India back into the game.

MS Dhoni turns up the heat in first training session in Chennai before IPL 2026: VideoIPL 2026: MS Dhoni trained with full intensity at Chennai Super Kings' high-performance centre, ramping up preparations for another season of the tournament. On Saturday, the 44-year-old Dhoni reached Chennai and was greeted with loud cheers.

Sikandar Raza heroics in vain as rampaging South Africa storm into semis unbeatenT20 World Cup, SA vs ZIM: South Africa beat Zimbabwe by five wickets in New Delhi to continue their unbeaten run in the tournament. Sikandar Raza put in an incredible all-round showing, but it wasn't enough for Zimbabwe to win.

Alyssa Healy's farewell spectacle hands India crushing 0-3 whitewash in ODI seriesAustralia completed a dominant 3-0 sweep over India in the Women's ODI series at Hobart. Alyssa Healy's spectacular century marked her ODI farewell, while India struggled against the relentless Australian attack.

Shoaib Malik denies fourth marriage rumours, says wife Sana targeted by trollsFormer Pakistan captain Shoaib Malik denied rumours of a fourth marriage and condemned online misinformation. He warned of legal consequences for those spreading defamatory content affecting his family.

IND vs WI Highlights: Sanju Samson's 97* guides India into semi finalIndia (IND) vs West Indies (WI), T20 World Cup Highlights: India have progressed into the semi-final of the tournament as Sanju Samson's unbeaten 97 helps his team chase down 196 in 19.2 overs.

Watch: Stuck in Dubai, PV Sindhu shares update amid West Asia crisisPV Sindhu shared her first video from Dubai after being stranded due to the Iran attacks. She revealed an explosion occurred close to where she and her team were taking shelter at the airport.

Bairstow pleads for help as England Lions stranded in Dubai due to crisisStar England cricketer Jonny Bairstow has made an urgent plea for help after the England Lions squad was stranded in the United Arab Emirates amid escalating conflict in the Middle East.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
